title: Pragati Maidan Metro Station renamed as Supreme Court Metro Station
author: Anmol Sharma
story: Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia has announced Pragati Maidan Metro Station has been renamed as Supreme Court Metro Station "after multiple requests". "The changes will reflect in Delhi Metro's systems in a month's time," he added. He further said that Mukarba Chowk and flyover have been renamed as Shaheed Captain Vikram Batra Chowk "in retrospect to the Kargil War martyr".

title: I go to award shows only if they pay me to host or give my film an award: Rohit
author: Daisy Mowke
story: Director Rohit Shetty revealed on No Filter Neha that he attends award shows only if he's paid to host or if his film is getting an award. "Otherwise no. Because it's...fake. It's all a TV show," he added. Rohit said he feels commercial entertainers aren't given their due at award functions, despite the fact that they're "more difficult" to make.

title: It's not ready yet: Musk on SpaceX internet satellite constellation
author: Kanishka Pandey
story: SpaceX Founder and CEO Elon Musk, responding to a Twitter user enquiring about the aerospace startup's Starlink internet satellite connectivity, said, "It's not ready yet." The Twitter user had said that parts of Australia are about to lose "communications phones and internet", adding, "Is there anything you can do? Starlink?" Notably, SpaceX is aiming to launch about 42,000 Starlink satellites.

title: Priyanka Gandhi should change her name to Feroze Priyanka: Union Minister
author: Jigyasu
story: After Congress leader Priyanka Gandhi Vadra's "saffron belongs to India's religious spirit" remark on UP CM Yogi Adityanath, Union Minister Sadhvi Niranjan Jyoti on Tuesday said Priyanka should change her name to "Feroze Priyanka". "She can't understand saffron because she is a fake Gandhi," Jyoti added. "She has problems with Adityanath as he is taking action against criminals," Jyoti added.

title: Govt has started on the wrong foot: Cong on appointment of CDS
author: Sakshita Khosla
story: Congress spokesperson Manish Tewari on Monday said that the central government has "started on a very wrong foot" with regards to appointment of General Bipin Rawat as India's first Chief of Defence Staff (CDS). In a series of tweets on Tuesday, he also raised questions on the appointment of a CDS indicating that it was "fraught with difficulties and ambiguities."

title: Railway Protection Force renamed as Indian Railway Protection Force Service
author: Anmol Sharma
story: The Railways has renamed its security force Railway Protection Force (RPF) as Indian Railway Protection Force Service. As per an order issued on Monday, the railway ministry accorded organised Group A status to RPF and renamed it. The force was established by Railway Protection Force Act, 1957, enacted by the Parliament for "the better protection and security of railway property".

title: Tamil Nadu govt school damaged in Cyclone Gaja rebuilt by volunteers
author: Apaar Sharma
story: A Chennai-based volunteers group, Direction for Volunteers (D4V), crowd-funded ₹8 lakh and rebuilt a school building in Tamil Nadu's Vandal. With this, they completed their target of rebuilding three schools damaged by Gaja Cyclone in 2018. The Direction for Volunteers had earlier rebuilt two schools in Thalaignayiru and in Kovilpathu at the cost of ₹7.7 lakh and ₹11.7 lakh respectively.

title: Chhota Shakeel plans to kill Chhota Rajan, security tightened at Tihar
author: Apaar Sharma
story: The security was increased in Delhi's Tihar jail where gangster Chhota Rajan is lodged after reports that underworld don Dawood Ibrahim's aide Chhota Shakeel is planning to kill Rajan inside the jail. According to reports, Rajan's three cooks have been changed and a distance of at least 10 metres is being strictly maintained between him and others inside the jail.

title: Police reimpose restrictions on movement of Cong leaders in Jammu
author: Apaar Sharma
story: The police asked Jammu and Kashmir Congress President GA Mir, former Deputy CM Tara Chand and three more Congress leaders to stay inside their houses in Jammu on Tuesday. Mir said that the leaders had planned to hold meetings over the next two days. They were earlier confined to their homes till October after Article 370 revocation on August 5.

title: Railways to invite bids from private companies to run 150 modern trains
author: Krishna Veera Vanamali
story: The Indian Railways will invite bids from private companies to run 150 modern trains based on a revenue-sharing model, Railway Board chairman Vinod Kumar Yadav said. The private trains will run on 100 routes, ending the Railways' monopoly in running trains. According to Railways' plan, private train operators can take trains on lease and provide better on-board experience and services.

title: SMS services to be restored in Kashmir from January 1 after 5 months
author: Anmol Sharma
story: J&K Principal Secretary Rohit Kansal has announced that SMS services in Kashmir valley will be restored from midnight. Further, broadband internet services in all government-run hospitals in Jammu and Kashmir will also be restored. The Valley had been without internet and SMS connectivity since August 5, when the Centre abrogated Article 370.

title: Talking to Trump on climate change would've been waste of time: Greta
author: Nandini Sinha
story: Climate change activist Greta Thunberg has said that talking to US President Donald Trump at a UN summit on global warming would have been a waste of time. "I don't think I would have said anything because obviously he's not listening to scientists and experts, so why would he listen to me? I probably wouldn't have said anything," she said.

title: Trailer of Kangana's 'Panga' impressed me a lot: Deepika Padukone
author: Atul Mishra
story: Deepika Padukone said at an event that the trailer of Kangana Ranaut's 'Panga' has impressed her a lot. "Looking at this trailer, which is painted by Kangana Ranaut's performance, it seems that this film will also be very good," she added. Kangana's sister Rangoli Chandel acknowledged Deepika's comment with a tweet that has a series of folded hands emoji.

title: Sharapova to return next month at Brisbane International
author: Dishant Sharma
story: Russian tennis player Maria Sharapova is set to return to professional tennis at the Brisbane International next month. Sharapova has been awarded a wildcard to play in the Australian Open warm-up tournament. The 32-year-old Russian will join current world number one Ash Barty, Naomi Osaka and Karolina Pliskova in Brisbane from January 6.

title: It was a tough year for Pakistan in Tests: Misbah-ul-Haq
author: Dishant Sharma
story: Speaking about the Pakistan cricket team's performance this year, head coach Misbah-ul-Haq said, "Pakistan ended 2019 on a high note with victory against Sri Lanka, but, overall, it was a tough year for Pakistan in Test cricket." "Going further, we have to improve a lot of things in both red-ball and white-ball cricket," Misbah added.

title: Bengal keep Dinda out of Ranji squad against Gujarat
author: Dishant Sharma
story: Bengal pacer Ashoke Dinda has been kept out of the squad for their upcoming Ranji Trophy Elite Group A fixture against Gujarat that is scheduled to start from January 3. The pacer, who has represented India in 13 ODIs and 9 T20Is, was dropped after he "abused" bowling coach Ranadeb Bose after a pre-match practice session and refused to apologise.

title: Bitcoin, dubbed the decade's best-performing asset, grew 90,00,000%
author: Dharna
story: Cryptocurrency Bitcoin has posted gains of over 90,00,000% through the decade, as per data compiled by Bloomberg. This makes Bitcoin, which was trading at more than $7,200 on Tuesday, the best-performing asset of the decade with the highest return-on-investment (ROI). Created in 2008 by someone named Satoshi Nakamoto, Bitcoin's price reached a record high of $19,783 per bitcoin in 2017.

title: Flipkart partners with govt to help SHGs sell products online
author: Aishwarya
story: Flipkart partnered with the government's Deendayal Antyodaya Yojana-National Urban Livelihoods Mission (DAY-NULM) to support self-help groups (SHGs) and bring their products online.  It will also collaborate on other projects under the scheme to establish Flipkart Samarth programme in 22 states. Flipkart would provide market access, training and support to SHGs which includes local businesses.

title: New US law requires probe of Marshall Islands nuclear dump
author: Dishant Sharma
story: The United States' Congress is demanding that the Department of Energy investigate an aging, cracking US nuclear waste dump threatened by climate change and rising seas in the Marshall Islands. As part of the new National Defense Authorization Act, signed last week by President Donald Trump, the energy agency must submit a report by mid-June.

title: 2019 was Russia's hottest year on record: Weather agency head
author: Dishant Sharma
story: Russia's Gidromedtsentr weather service's head Roman Vilfand has revealed that the year 2019 was the hottest ever registered in Russia. Vilfand said Moscow's average temperature for 2019 had hit 7.6-7.7 degrees Celsius, beating the previous record by 0.3 degrees. Weather records have been kept since 1879 in Moscow and since 1891 in Russia as a whole.

title: Indonesia protests to China on intrusion on its maritime border
author: Shailesh
story: Indonesia claimed that it has protested to China over the presence of a Chinese Coast Guard vessel in its Exclusive Economic Zone (EEZ) off the Natuna islands in the South China Sea (SCS). Chinese Foreign Ministry spokesman Geng Shuang said that China has sovereignty over islands near Natuna. He added that the two countries have "normal" fishing activity in SCS.

title: US airstrikes in Iraq and Syria acts of terrorism: Iran
author: Kirti Joshi
story: Iran on Monday said that strikes by the US against five targets of Iranian backed paramilitary groups in Iraq and Syria are an act of terrorism. "US military aggression against Iraqi soil and Iraqi forces is strongly condemned," the Iranian Foreign Ministry spokesman said. At least 25 people were killed and 55 were wounded in the US airstrikes.

title: UK proposed NATO membership for Russia, files reveal
author: Kirti Joshi
story: UK officials suggested inviting Russia as an "associate member" to join NATO to "integrate" it into the West after the end of the Cold War, documents released by the UK's National Archives revealed on Tuesday. The 1995 proposal, presented by the then Defence Secretary Malcolm Rifkind, was later dismissed at a meeting in January.

title: Axis Bank appoints Amit Talgeri as its Chief Risk Officer
author: Anushka Dixit
story: Axis Bank has appointed Amit Talgeri as its Chief Risk Officer (CRO) for the next three years starting January 1, 2020, replacing Cyril Anand. The bank has also appointed Naveen Tahilyani as the Group Executive - Head Banking Operations and Transformation. Notably, Axis Bank's shares rose 1.21% to about ₹763.30 following the announcement of the appointments.

title: Sensex falls 300 points in year's last session, gained 14% in 2019
author: Dharna
story: Indian equity benchmark index Sensex fell by 304 points in the year's last trading session to settle at 41,253. The broader Nifty 50 index ended at 12,168 on Tuesday, declining by 0.7% or 87 points. While Sensex rose over 14% in 2019, Nifty registered gains of 12% in the calendar year.

Lens now on cash declarations made to Customs
India prepares for New Year's Eve with fresh protests against citizenship law
story: Thousands of Indians are set to ring in the New Year by holding protests against a citizenship law, despite Prime Minister Narendra Modi's attempts to dampen demonstrations that have run for nearly three weeks.

title: Freezing weather causes deaths in India and Bangladesh
story: The second coldest weather in 119 years sweeping across western and northern India has led to dense fog, killing at least six people and disrupting many parts of the country, including the capital New Delhi.

title: Exclusive: Indian PM Modi's office proposes waiving carbon tax on coal
story: Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi's office has proposed waiving a tax on coal to help finance pollution-curbing equipment, according to documents, but the move would also make coal more competitive in price with solar and wind energy.

title: Explainer: Why India's new citizenship plans are stirring protests
story: (This corrects paragraph 9 to remove reference to the majority of excluded residents in Assam being Muslim, amends to show there was no official breakdown by religion in December 23 story.)

title: Tourists stay away from Taj Mahal, other Indian attractions as protests flare
story: India's tourism industry has been hit by a wave of violent anti-government protests against a new citizenship law that have rocked several cities this month, with at least seven countries issuing travel warnings.

title: Hardline leader in Indian state defends 'strict' action to quell protests
story: The chief minister of India's Uttar Pradesh state has rebuffed accusations from rights groups of police abuses during protests against a new citizenship law, crediting his tough stand with restoring calm to the streets.

title: India security clampdown keeps citizenship law protests under control
story: India deployed thousands of police and shut down mobile internet services across many cities on Friday to control protests against a new citizenship law, with flashpoint Friday prayers passing largely peacefully.

title: Norwegian, 71, told to leave India after joining citizenship law protest
story: A Norwegian woman on holiday in India's southern state of Kerala has been told to leave the country after she joined a protest against Prime Minister Narendra Modi's new citizenship law, authorities said on Friday.

title: In an Indian village, a woman's killing and alleged rape opens caste divides
story: When the young woman limped toward shopkeeper Ravindra Prakash, pleading for help on a dark and foggy morning in the northern Indian village, her body was so charred that he thought she was a witch. He grabbed a wooden stick and tried to shoo her away.

title: The Runaway Husbands
story: (This Dec. 10 story has been refiled to correct to remove extra comma in penultimate paragraph)

title: 'I'm still scared' - Asia remembers tsunami that killed 230,000
story: Communities across Asia commemorated the more than 230,000 victims of the Indian Ocean tsunami on Thursday, the 15th anniversary of one of the world's most deadly disasters.

title: Blindspot to backlash: India's Modi and party misread the mood
story: Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi's government did not anticipate the protests against a new citizenship law that have raged across the country and is now scrambling to control the damage, members of his ruling party said.

title: Indian state demands damages, threatens to confiscate property over protests
story: India's northern Uttar Pradesh state is demanding millions of rupees from over 200 people and threatening to confiscate their property as a penalty for damage done to public property during protests against the country's new citizenship law.
